wikipedia_page.main: Caroline Alice Lejeune (27 March 1897 – 31 March 1973) was a British writer, best known for serving as the film critic for The Observer from 1928 to 1960. She was among the earliest newspaper film critics and is thought to have been the first British woman in the profession, with her first regular film column predating Iris Barry's earliest contribution to The Spectator of this kind by about a year.
